job_details.Functieomschrijving:
The Data Engineering team is the core of Data, which everything else relies upon. The team is responsible for the development and management of the Enterprise Data Platform, which powers the company and all respective Data functions. The Enterprise Data Platform is crucial for integrating, managing, and providing data across the business. There are multiple sub-disciplines within Data Engineering, each contributing to the overall effectiveness and efficiency of data operations. It is a highly cohesive team consisting of the 4 pods, Data Infrastructure, ML & GenAI Ops, Analytics Engineering & Data Services.

   They architect and build the core data infrastructure to support the entire company, build data ingestions from internal & external applications, support infra for ML & GenAI products and applications, merge various data feeds and combining them into easy to use, valuable data sets to support analytics and design and create scalable and packaged data solutions in the form of various data services., We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the Data Services pod in the established Data Engineering team.

   As a Data Engineer, you will be instrumental in developing and maintaining data solutions and data pipeline infrastructure supporting broader data-heavy functions within the company, including Reporting, Analytics and Data Science. The Data Engineer collaborates with Software Development and DevOps teams to maintain scalability, reliability and maintainability of the company's overall technical stack. The Data Engineer also works closely with business and product teams to ensure timeliness and efficiency of data-driven decision making.

   The primary focus of this role is to design, develop and implement clean and structured data for use by analysts and reporting. Responsibilities also include quality documentation and adherence to Data Engineering best practices.

   What you will do:
     * Operate in a remote-first environment collaborating with individuals and teams distributed across multiple time zones worldwide
     * Work with internal partner teams, and, occasionally, external partners on defining the scope and the requirements for Data Engineering projects
     * Design, develop and implement Data Engineering solutions
     * Maintain work performance, transparency, and process compliance through usage of the company's task tracking tools and communication channels

     * Participate in projects of a broader Engineering and Data teams by acting as SME and as a contributor to business and engineering initiatives

     * Work on continuous improvement of Company's Data Engineering practices through platform/tools evaluation, documentation, knowledge sharing, etc
job_details.full_text:
Data Engineer

The Data Engineering team is the core of Data, which everything else relies upon. The team is responsible for the development and management of the Enterprise Data Platform, which powers the company and all respective Data functions. The Enterprise Data Platform is crucial for integrating, managing, and providing data across the business. There are multiple sub-disciplines within Data Engineering, each contributing to the overall effectiveness and efficiency of data operations. It is a highly cohesive team consisting of the 4 pods, Data Infrastructure, ML & GenAI Ops, Analytics Engineering & Data Services.

   They architect and build the core data infrastructure to support the entire company, build data ingestions from internal & external applications, support infra for ML & GenAI products and applications, merge various data feeds and combining them into easy to use, valuable data sets to support analytics and design and create scalable and packaged data solutions in the form of various data services., We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the Data Services pod in the established Data Engineering team.

   As a Data Engineer, you will be instrumental in developing and maintaining data solutions and data pipeline infrastructure supporting broader data-heavy functions within the company, including Reporting, Analytics and Data Science. The Data Engineer collaborates with Software Development and DevOps teams to maintain scalability, reliability and maintainability of the company's overall technical stack. The Data Engineer also works closely with business and product teams to ensure timeliness and efficiency of data-driven decision making.

   The primary focus of this role is to design, develop and implement clean and structured data for use by analysts and reporting. Responsibilities also include quality documentation and adherence to Data Engineering best practices.

   What you will do:
     * Operate in a remote-first environment collaborating with individuals and teams distributed across multiple time zones worldwide
     * Work with internal partner teams, and, occasionally, external partners on defining the scope and the requirements for Data Engineering projects
     * Design, develop and implement Data Engineering solutions
     * Maintain work performance, transparency, and process compliance through usage of the company's task tracking tools and communication channels

     * Participate in projects of a broader Engineering and Data teams by acting as SME and as a contributor to business and engineering initiatives

     * Work on continuous improvement of Company's Data Engineering practices through platform/tools evaluation, documentation, knowledge sharing, etc

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional data engineering tasks such as building data pipelines, managing data platforms, and preparing data for analytics and reporting. While it mentions supporting ML & GenAI Ops, it does not indicate direct involvement in developing or fine-tuning ML/GenAI models, which is the core of a GenAI Engineer role.

phrases: development and management of the Enterprise Data Platform
architect and build the core data infrastructure
build data ingestions from internal & external applications
merge various data feeds and combining them into easy to use, valuable data sets
design and create scalable and packaged data solutions in the form of various data services
developing and maintaining data solutions and data pipeline infrastructure
Design, develop and implement Data Engineering solutions
quality documentation and adherence to Data Engineering best practices
continuous improvement of Company's Data Engineering practices
job_tasks.justification: These phrases directly describe the creation, maintenance, and management of data infrastructure, pipelines, and services, which are the core activities of data engineering.

phrases: powering the company and all respective Data functions
crucial for integrating, managing, and providing data across the business
supporting broader data-heavy functions within the company, including Reporting, Analytics and Data Science
works closely with business and product teams to ensure timeliness and efficiency of data-driven decision making
design, develop and implement clean and structured data for use by analysts and reporting
defining the scope and the requirements for Data Engineering projects
acting as SME and as a contributor to business and engineering initiatives
job_tasks.justification: These phrases highlight the need to understand business needs, align data solutions with business goals, and work with business stakeholders to deliver value.

phrases: collaborates with Software Development and DevOps teams to maintain scalability, reliability and maintainability of the company's overall technical stack
design and create scalable and packaged data solutions in the form of various data services
job_tasks.justification: While not the primary focus, the role involves collaboration with software development teams and designing scalable data services, indicating some involvement in software engineering principles.

phrases: ML & GenAI Ops
support infra for ML & GenAI products and applications
job_tasks.justification: The job description mentions supporting infrastructure for ML & GenAI Ops, indicating an awareness and indirect involvement in the operational aspects of these technologies, but not direct MLOps engineering.

phrases: Operate in a remote-first environment collaborating with individuals and teams distributed across multiple time zones worldwide
Work with internal partner teams, and, occasionally, external partners on defining the scope and the requirements for Data Engineering projects
collaborates with Software Development and DevOps teams
works closely with business and product teams
soft_skills.justification: The role explicitly mentions collaboration with various internal and external teams, including those across different time zones, and working with business stakeholders.

phrases: continuous improvement of Company's Data Engineering practices through platform/tools evaluation, documentation, knowledge sharing, etc
soft_skills.justification: The emphasis on continuous improvement and evaluating new platforms/tools suggests a need for learning and adapting to new technologies and practices.

phrases: architect and build the core data infrastructure
build data ingestions
merge various data feeds and combining them into easy to use, valuable data sets
design and create scalable and packaged data solutions
Design, develop and implement Data Engineering solutions
maintain scalability, reliability and maintainability of the company's overall technical stack
soft_skills.justification: The core responsibilities involve designing, building, and maintaining complex data systems, which inherently requires problem-solving skills to ensure scalability, reliability, and efficiency.

phrases: architect and build the core data infrastructure
design and create scalable and packaged data solutions
Design, develop and implement Data Engineering solutions
continuous improvement of Company's Data Engineering practices through platform/tools evaluation
soft_skills.justification: The role requires designing and building core infrastructure and solutions, and taking initiative in improving practices, suggesting a need for ownership and a proactive approach.
